snippet: Many Turks have put aside political differences after a failed military uprising — although some may be motivated by fear in the wake of the president’s purge of suspected political enemies....
abstract: Turkish conservatives and moderates, united in their opposition to military coups and movement of Muslim cleric Fethullah Gulen, are experiencing rare moment of solidarity in aftermath of failed coup attempt; Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan has leveraged event to focus public on common enemy, while at same time carrying out sweeping anti-Gulenist purge of government that has drawn criticism from some rights activists.

byline.contributor: Tim Arango and Safak Timur contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Many Turks have put aside political differences after a failed military uprising — although some may be motivated by fear in the wake of the president’s purge of suspected political enemies.

headline.main: After Failed Coup, Turkey Enjoys a Rare Period of Unity
headline.print_headline: After Coup Attempt, Turkey Enjoys a Rare Period of Unity

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
